messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 798
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/7/2003 7:47:26 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... My aunt and Uncle have two grown children, one of whom is a schoolteacher (who thinks
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/7/2003 7:47:26 AM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

> >THIS is how homeschooling should look. I actually started describing
> >Unschooling (usually don't bother), and they were enthusiastic.
>
> Did they have children? (OH, or are THEY the parents of Dumb Fucks 1 &2?
> Nah!)
>
> I've found that the schooled mindset seems to be MUCH more ingrained in
> PARENTS. My friends who have no children really GET unschooling and are
> VERY
> supportive---even the "educators". It's as if the DAY you have a child---
> "education" becomes all-important. Like they can't see any further than a
> good school (and we all know how they sell houses! <g>)!
>
> How weird is THAT?
>
> I'm sorry for those two children. And glad Julian has you!
>

My aunt and Uncle have two grown children, one of whom is a schoolteacher
(who thinks homeschooling is cool) and another who works for Brown
University.

No, the verbally abusive (also physically abusive) parents are Julian's
father's parents. While not supportive, neither (my ex-fil has now died) has
ever talked that way to Julian. And Perry and I agreed long ago they would
never see Julian unsupervised.

Thank you...and we're SO glad we have Julian. He's really worked out quite
nicely ;)

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
